questions.question: What is the primary characteristic of a transverse wave?
options: Particles oscillate parallel to the direction of energy transfer.
Particles oscillate perpendicular to the direction of energy transfer.
It does not require a medium to travel.
It is a type of sound wave.
questions.correctAnswer: Particles oscillate perpendicular to the direction of energy transfer.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a longitudinal wave?
What does the amplitude of a wave represent?
options: The number of waves passing a point per second
The maximum displacement from the equilibrium position
The distance between two consecutive crests
questions.correctAnswer: The maximum displacement from the equilibrium position
